answers.answer: It might be the baby. My little one was up in my ribs on my left and I had to work at getting him to move because it hurt and made breathing hard. Try prying at your baby from the lower last rib and push in and down. yYou have to keep doing it to wake the little one up and to make it move. I hope this is the problem and works for you!!!

i had this last week in my 22nd week of pregnancy. Contact your midwife or doctor asap. There was talk of appendicitis or the baby sitting on a nerve etc. turned out it was a urine infection in my case. I was in so much pain with it and even after taking antibiotics the pain was still there for 3 days. Not nice at all. Hope you get sorted and feel better soon

Thanks ladies i don't think she's the problem cuz she's been moving around like by my belly button an below. I was jus at my drs yesterday an she asked if everything was going good I say yes an then wake up to this if it doesn't stop or change I'll definitely be calling her.

I also have the pain on the back of my right ribs, it's been going on for 6 days. Mine is like pinching pain, it worsens even doing basic household stuffs like doing the dishes, vacuuming, etc. My baby has been moving all over. So I don't think it is the baby. I am 25+4 days and went to see the doctor yesterday and he prescribed me FLEXERIL. But at the same time I have really bad sinus and he also prescribed me two other medicines. I am not sure if I should take all of them. As I don't like taking too many medicines at the same time and specially being pregnant.  My doctor checked for the sinus but he never checked for my rib pain, so I didn't take my back pain medicine last night. sorry for long post. I read online that if you have a severe headache and pain on your right shoulder or abdomen, it could be sign of preeclampsia.  So I asked my doctor and he said since I am 29 I don't need to worry about it. But I have gained almost 20 pounds this pregnancy and it's my first pregnancy. I hope your doctor listens to you more and hope you know what's causing the pain. I would love to hear back from you all.

question: Hi i was woken out of my sleep with this horrible pain right below my right rib cage it hurts really bad to breathe even worse with a deep breathe i have to take really small breathes. But its still a constant pain breathing just makes it worse. Whether I'm still or moving it hurts. After getting out of bed I sat on the couch when I stood up the pain shot across my upper stomach does anyone have any idea what this is. This is my third pregnancy never had this happen before. I will be 23 weeks tomorrow.
title: Looking for some help!!!! Have this horrible pain...
